title: Easy Baked Tilapia Recipe
description: This baked tilapia recipe with simple ingredients is super easy to prepare, and ready in 30 minutes for a quick and delicious weeknight meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Seafood Fish Tilapia Baked Easy Baked Tilapia 4.5 (1,264) 899 Reviews 157 Photos This baked tilapia recipe is super easy. It only takes a few minutes to prepare, uses few ingredients, and is flavorful. Submitted by F_Gory Updated on November 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 157 157 157 157 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 (4 ounce) fillets tilapia 2 teaspoons butter ½ teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste ¼ teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®), or to taste 1 lemon, sliced 1 (16 ounce) package frozen cauliflower with broccoli and red pepper salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees F). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place tilapia fillets in the bottom of the baking dish, then dot with butter and season with garlic salt and seafood seasoning. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios. Top each fillet with a slice or two of lemon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios. Arrange frozen mixed vegetables around fillets and season lightly with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios. Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and fish flakes easily with a fork, 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios. Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,900 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Baked Tilapia 01 of 157 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 157 Photo by  Jess Coplans 03/16/2022 It was good for being so easy. I didn’t measure my Old Bay or garlic salt because I measure those with my heart (i.e. a lot.) I would recommend putting effort into your rice and be careful on which frozen veggies you buy, Green Giant is always good. :) 03 of 157 Photo by  Shamica Williams 03/17/2021 04 of 157 Photo by  rayrayus 02/17/2021 05 of 157 Photo by  TeeTee925 12/17/2020 06 of 157 Photo by  cdmarie 10/09/2020 07 of 157 Photo by  cdmarie 10/09/2020 08 of 157 Photo by  Monica Beck 10/03/2020 09 of 157 Photo by  Eva 09/16/2020 10 of 157 Photo by  Tryphena 03/16/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love LaWanna's Mango Salsa on Tilapia Fillets 11 Ratings Fiery Fish Tacos with Crunchy Corn Salsa 956 Ratings Italian Style Flounder 201 Ratings Moroccan Shabbat Fish 27 Ratings Ginger Glazed Mahi Mahi 2,829 Ratings Tilapia with Tomatoes, Black Olives and Corn 99 Ratings Pasta with Tuna Sauce 165 Ratings Healthier Easy Baked Tilapia 70 Ratings Parchment Baked Salmon 95 Ratings Teriyaki Tuna Patties 432 Ratings One-Dish Rockfish 162 Ratings Spinach-Stuffed Flounder with Mushrooms and Feta 159 Ratings Honey Lime Tilapia 92 Ratings Lemony Steamed Fish 168 Ratings Sweet 'n' Hot Glazed Salmon 197 Ratings Easy Seafood Alfredo 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: F_Gory
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees F). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.;Place tilapia fillets in the bottom of the baking dish, then dot with butter and season with garlic salt and seafood seasoning. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios.;Top each fillet with a slice or two of lemon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios.;Arrange frozen mixed vegetables around fillets and season lightly with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios.;Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and fish flakes easily with a fork, 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios.;Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
